intro: Rockhausenia weberbaueriana, commonly known as the Weberbauer's rockhausenia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky and mountainous habitats, showcasing adaptations to high-altitude environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in umbels, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
